name: OVGuide
overview:
OVGuide is THE destination site to search and discover free online high quality videos on the Web.

OVGuide.com is the #1 independent online video guidance site and has the most comprehensive and up-to-date guide to online video, including TV shows, movies, user-generated content and video games. Headquartered in Los Angeles, the privately held company was founded by Dale Bock in 2006. The company is backed by Baroda Ventures, whose founder David Bohnett was also the founder of GeoCities that was once ranked as one of the four most trafficked sites on the Web, went public in 1998 and was subsequently acquired by Yahoo! in 1999.

Content discovery features include editor’s pick videos, content browsing tools, movie/TV browse tools and listings of real-time keyword searches. The site receives more than 12 million unique visitors every month and was named by Time Magazine as a Top 10 Best Website of the year when the site first launched in 2006.

funding_rounds.source_description: Baroda Ventures Invests $5 Million Into OVGuide.com

acquisitions.source_description: OVGuide Acquires Live Matrix, Sanjay Reddy Appointed CEO

milestones.description: comScore ranks OVGuide.com Third-Fastest Growing Web Property in the US
milestones.source_text:
BEVERLY HILLS, CA, Aug 05 (MARKET WIRE) -- 
OVGuide.com, the Internet's most comprehensive guide to online video
sites, including TV shows, movies, user-generated content and games,
today announced that comScore has ranked it the third-fastest growing Web
property in the US, in terms of audience size, from May 2007-2008. Other
impressive 2008 results for the company to-date include visits from more
than 100 million individuals in total from around the globe.
Additionally, the site now receives 12 million unique visitors per
month(1).

    2008 has been a year of explosive growth in online video. A recent report
issued by Integrated Media Measurement revealed that more than 20% of
Americans watched some prime-time TV on a computer during the spring TV
season, which is a 233% increase compared to the fall of 2007(2).
OVGuide.com has experienced a similar surge in popularity. According to
Alexa.com, OVGuide.com has, since the beginning of the year, gone from
being outside the top 1,000 Web properties to a top 150 site in the US; is
one of the UK's top 130 most visited Web sites; and is overall a top 1,000
site in more than 20 countries.

    OVGuide.com also issued its July online video alert today, identifying the
most popular movie and television destinations, video genres and search
terms for the past month. The results include:


Top five searches:
1.  Hancock
2.  The Love Guru
3.  The Dark Knight
4.  WALL-E
5.  Hellboy II

Top five genres:
1.  Movies / TV
2.  Anime
3.  General / Viral
4.  Games
5.  Sports

OVGuide.com new addition 'highlights':
1.  Beijing Olympics 2008
2.  CrashTestKitchen
3.  Cycling.TV
4.  GeekBrief.TV
5.  Magicians.com
6.  Men's Health
7.  Tidio
8.  TravelPod.com
9.  Vlaze.com
10. TheWineryChannel.tv

    
"I founded OVGuide.com in 2006 as I saw the need for a destination to
help individuals find online video, and sites at the time did not provide
a viable solution," said Dale Bock, founder and president of OVGuide.com.
"We have dedicated the past two years to scouring the Web for the best,
high-quality video sites to include in our comprehensive database. Our
dedicated editorial team that categorizes each outlet by genre has also
helped our search engine become the most accurate in the industry. We are
continuing to strive to be the destination for consumers to search and
discover online video content, and are thrilled with the progress we have
made in the industry."

    OVGuide.com processed 11 million searches in July and averaged over eight
page views per user. To find out more about OVGuide.com or discover the
most popular sites in online video, please visit www.ovguide.com.

    About OVGuide.com

    Founded in 2006, OVGuide.com is the Internet's most comprehensive guide to
online video sites, including TV shows, movies, user-generated content and
video games. Headquartered in Los Angeles, the privately-held company
delivers an innovative, user-friendly way to search and browse relevant,
high-quality video content on the Web. OVGuide.com currently indexes more
than 2,000 online destinations, offering both short- and long-form video
integrated into an intuitive and categorized directory. The site offers a
very relevant, powerful search engine, receiving more than 11 million
visitors, 80 million page views and 10 million searches per month.
OVGuide.com's team of experienced editors review all video sites prior to
listing them, ensuring all content listed is valuable and categorized
appropriately.
milestones.source_description: comScore ranks OVGuide.com Third-Fastest Growing Web Property in the US

milestones.description: Unveils search engine that combines technology and human editorial to find the most relevant online video search results on the Web
